intro: Malache hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy malache, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical berries. Malache hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
